snippet: Irom Sharmila began refusing to eat almost 14 years ago to protest a law that gives impunity to armed forces serving in the insurgency-racked state of Manipur.
abstract: Court in northeastern Indian state of Manipur orders release of Irom Sharmila, activist who has been imprisoned on charges of attempted suicide since she began a hunger strike nearly 14 years ago.
lead_paragraph: Irom Sharmila began refusing to eat almost 14 years ago to protest a law that gives impunity to armed forces serving in the insurgency-racked state of Manipur.

headline.main: Court Orders Release of Hunger-Striking Indian Activist
headline.print_headline: India: Release Is Ordered for Activist in Suicide Case
